screen_desc: The screenshot displays the "Virtual Keyboard" settings on an Android device. It shows two active keyboard options: "Gboard" (for multilingual typing) and "Google voice typing" (set to automatic). There is also an option to "Manage keyboards" by adding or removing keyboards. The interface is clean, with a simple layout for easy navigation and customization of input methods.
history_actions: click on the Settings icon located at the upper left.
click on the "System" option located at the middle-lower part of the screen.
click on the "Languages & input" located at the upper left.
click on the "Virtual keyboard" settings located at the left and upper middle part of the screen.

think_action.Thought: The user wants to change the keyboard's appearance. Based on the current screen, the next step is to enter the settings of the active keyboard (Gboard), as it typically provides customization options such as themes and layouts.
Future Action Plan: Click on 'Gboard' to access its settings.
Navigate to the 'Theme' or appearance-related option.
Select a new keyboard theme or customize the look as desired.
think_action.Next Single Step Action: Click on 'Gboard' to access its settings.
